item.title: Car careens off interchange between 75 and 64 in Bradenton
item.description: A car veered off the 220 exit ramp from I-75 just after 5 a.m. Sunday morning.

item.title: Tampa Police rescue man from burning house
item.description: Tampa Police rescue man from burning house

item.title: Lighting strike causes Citrus County house fire
item.description: The homeowner said they heard a lightning strike just before seeing smoke and fire near the kitchen and the laundry room.

item.title: ‘Please don’t let this be real...’ Nokomis arson victim’s family speaks out
item.description: The victim was removed from the trailer, and paramedics attempted life-saving measures, but the victim was declared dead at 1:48 a.m.

item.title: Booker Tornadoes host back-to-school community giveaway event
item.description: First year head coach, Carlos Woods, and the Booker Tornadoes football program are doing their part in helping students as they prepare to head back to school.

item.title: ‘All indications are’ body found in pond is missing 18-year-old, Manatee sheriff’s office says
item.description: Investigators have preliminarily identified the body as missing Giovanni Pelletier.

item.title: Search for a wanted felon continues by Venice Police
item.description: Authorities urge residents in the area to call 911 if they see someone suspicious.

item.title: Kids head back to school in Manatee County
item.description: Kids head back to school in Manatee County!

item.title: Plans for new North Port hospital are already expanding
item.description: Groundbreaking is planned for November on property SMH owns on North Sumter Boulevard.

item.title: Typical summertime weather settles in
item.description: The focus for storm development will remain on the coast on Tuesday.

item.title: Caught on Camera: Tampa Police rush into burning home to save occupant
item.description: The man and officers were treated for smoke inhalation and are now OK.

item.title: Erin forecast to become a major hurricane this weekend
item.description: Erin is moving quickly westward, and will continue on that trajectory for the next few days as it slowly strengthens.
